reg32.name: UNK0D60
reg32.doc: Goes to MP, VATTR by default, 16-bit

reg32.name: DEPTH_CLIP_NEGATIVE_Z
reg32.doc: This determines where depth values are clipped before the viewport transformation, whereas DEPTH_RANGE applies after it. If true, the permitted depth range is [0,1], otherwise [-1,1]. Goes to VCLIP.

reg32.name: STACK_SIZE_LOG
reg32.doc: log2(number_of_entries)+1. 1-0xd, or 0 to disable stack. note that stack is always at least 4 entries, vals 1 and 2 are equivalent to 3.

reg32.name: STRMOUT_PARAMS_LATCH
reg32.doc: Needed after changing strmout params. Probably resets some state too.

reg32.name: ZCULL_UNK0DBC
VTX_ATTR_MASK_UNK0DD0
reg32.doc: A mask of something for vertex attrs. Most likely.

reg32.name: UNK0DDC
reg32.doc: 0-2, causes something to happen in vfetch.

reg32.name: WATCHDOG_TIMER
reg32.doc: Writing 0 disables watchdog, writing 1-31 causes program to be killed after 7*2^(x-1) clocks [?].

reg32.name: PRIM_RESTART_WITH_DRAW_ARRAYS
reg32.doc: Whether primitive restart applies to drawing via VERTEX_BUFFER_FIRST,COUNT.

reg32.name: LOCAL_WARPS_LOG_ALLOC
reg32.doc: number of bits in l[] addressing used for warp number. as a twist, 5 is invalid. use 7 if you want 5. valid vals 0-4 and 7

reg32.name: LOCAL_WARPS_NO_CLAMP
reg32.doc: if not set, clamp number of executed warps to allocated above. if set, ignore it, the extra warps will alias.

reg32.name: STACK_WARPS_LOG_ALLOC
reg32.doc: number of bits in stack addressing used for warp number. as a twist, 5 is invalid. use 7 if you want 5. valid vals 0-4 and 7

reg32.name: STACK_WARPS_NO_CLAMP
reg32.doc: if not set, clamp number of executed warps to allocated above. if set, ignore it, the extra warps will alias.

reg32.name: UNK0F78
reg32.doc: Goes to ROP. Default 3e60 on NV50, 1ffe67 on G84+, 87e67 on NVA[358].

reg32.name: COLOR_MASK_COMMON
reg32.doc: If enabled, only COLOR_MASK(0) works and affects all RTs.

reg32.name: UNK0FAC
reg32.doc: Goes to MP, RMASK. Default is 0xff101.

reg32.name: UNK1040
reg32.doc: Doesn't seem to do anything in DISPATCH. G84+? Scan pending. Maybe related to magic3

reg32.name: UNK1100
reg32.doc: 0-3, goes to ATTR, TRAST. 3 by default.

reg32.name: VERTEX_ID_BASE
reg32.doc: VERTEX_ID starts counting from this value on every VERTEX_BEGIN.

reg32.name: PRIMITIVE_ID
reg32.doc: PRIMITIVE_ID counter. Zeroed by VERTEX_BEGIN unless proper flag passed.

reg32.name: VTX_ATTR_MASK_UNK0DD0_ALT
reg32.doc: A mask of something for vertex attrs. Most likely.

reg32.name: UNK1140
reg32.doc: 0 or 0x10. Goes to PROP, MP, ROP.

reg32.name: UNK1238
reg32.doc: Accepts 0-0x3fffff, causes CCACHE_TRAP. Same as turing UNK03CC.

bitfield.name: LINEAR
bitfield.doc: If set, WIDTH is byte pitch instead of pixel width.

reg32.name: UNK128C
reg32.doc: Each of fields is 0-2. Goes to eng2d.

reg32.name: CALL_LIMIT_LOG
reg32.doc: Determines how many "limitted" calls are allowed. Value 0 means none. Values 1-8 are interpretted as log2(limit)+1. Value 0xf means unlimitted.

reg32.name: UNK12A0
reg32.doc: Goes to MP, mangled beyond all recognition.

bitfield.name: UNK1
bitfield.doc: Cannot be more than UNK3

bitfield.name: UNK2
bitfield.doc: Cannot be more than UNK1

reg32.name: UNK12B8
reg32.doc: Goes to MP. Valid vals are 0, 1, 100, 101. GP-related?

bitfield.name: UNK1
bitfield.doc: Accepts 0-2. 2 is used for flushing texture caches.

reg32.name: BLEND_SEPARATE_ALPHA
reg32.doc: Separate values for RGB and ALPHA. Applies to both factor and equation. Use RGB methods if disabled.

bitfield.name: Y_NEGATE
bitfield.doc: Negates screen Y coord, needs positive WINDOW_OFFSET_Y to be useful.

bitfield.name: TRIANGLE_RAST_FLIP
bitfield.doc: If false, sample is in triangle if on left edge or on top edge. If true, sample is in triangle if on bottom edge or on top edge. Top means "at lower FINAL x coord in RT [after Y_NEGATE]". This also affects face winding.

reg32.name: UNK141C
reg32.doc: Bits 0x07fff000. Goes to RAST, MP. 0x01000000 by default. Scan pending. This is one of the magic3 motherfuckers. GP-related?

reg32.name: VERTEX_ARRAY_FLUSH
reg32.doc: Flushes VBO caches. Accepts 0 and 1, both seem to work.

reg32.name: UNK1430
reg32.doc: Goes to ROP. Both set when NOT MS/CS.

reg32.name: CODE_CB_FLUSH
reg32.doc: Works with writing 0, but appears to accept values 0-3... what do they do, if anything?

reg32.name: UNK1568
reg32.doc: Accepts anything. Same as turing UNK02B0.

bitfield.name: UNK1
bitfield.doc: Accepts 0-3

bitfield.name: UNK2
bitfield.doc: Accepts 0-7

reg32.name: UNK15B0
reg32.doc: Same as turing UNK30C. Per-shader type?

reg32.name: CSAA_ENABLE
reg32.brief: if disabled, extra CSAA samples are ignored.

bitfield.name: IDX
bitfield.doc: The layer to render into, when not selected by GP.

bitfield.name: INSTANCE_NEXT
bitfield.doc: If set, INSTANCE_ID is increased by 1, otherwise it's set to 0.

bitfield.name: PRIMITIVE_ID_CONT
bitfield.doc: If set, PRIMITIVE_ID is unmodified, otherwise it's set to 0.

bitfield.name: INSTANCE_CONT
bitfield.doc: If set, INSTANCE_ID is unmodified, otherwise see INSTANCE_NEXT description.

bitfield.name: INSTANCE_NEXT
bitfield.doc: If set, INSTANCE_ID is increased by 1, otherwise it's set to 0.

bitfield.name: PRIMITIVE_ID_CONT
bitfield.doc: If set, PRIMITIVE_ID is unmodified, otherwise it's set to 0.

bitfield.name: INSTANCE_CONT
bitfield.doc: If set, INSTANCE_ID is unmodified, otherwise see INSTANCE_NEXT description.

bitfield.name: VERTEX_ID_DRAW_ARRAYS_ADD_START
bitfield.doc: For non-indexed drawing, whether to start counting from 0 (if false) or VERTEX_BUFFER_FIRST.

reg32.name: POINT_RASTER_RULES
reg32.doc: Affects at least X coord mode and POINT_SMOOTH_ENABLE.

bitfield.name: ALWAYS_DERIV
bitfield.doc: Always use auto LOD selection by implicit derivatives, even in program types other than FP.

reg32.name: STRMOUT_OFFSET
reg32.doc: Position in a buffer, in bytes. Write result of corresponding QUERY to resume a paused transform feedback.

reg32.name: CLIP_DISTANCE_MODE
reg32.doc: A Primitive is culled if any cull distance is less than 0 for all its vertices. In CULL mode, triangles are unmodified if they intersect a plane. In CLIP mode, the expected "cutting" occurs.

reg32.name: ZCULL_VALIDATE
reg32.doc: Set all ZCULL tiles to CLEAR_DEPTH if CLEAR_UNK0 is 1. Changing the test direction or writing FragDepth does not deactivate ZCULL, at least not for untouched tiles. Upon writing ZCULL tiles, the values in the actual depth buffer are checked.

reg32.name: FP_CTRL_UNK196C
reg32.doc: 0x11 if DEPR written. Goes to ZCULL.

reg32.name: CLIPID_FILL
reg32.doc: Writes param to CLIPID subrectangle specified by intersection of SCREEN_SCISSOR and CLIPID_FILL_RECT.

reg32.name: UNK19D8
reg32.doc: Accepts: 2-6, 8, a, c, e, 10. Goes to VCLIP, translated first. ctxvals bits 0-3 and 4-7 == val >> 1, bit 8 == val&1.

bitfield.doc: Anything non-0.

reg32.name: UNK1A2C
reg32.doc: Accepts anything. Same as turing UNK0330. Value seems ignored.

reg32.name: UNK1A30
reg32.doc: Accepts anything. Same as turing UNK0340. Goes to VFETCH, VCLIP, VATTR, MP, STRMOUT, GEOM.

reg32.name: UNK1A34
reg32.doc: Accepts anything. Same as turing UNK0344. Goes to TEX, MP.

reg32.name: UNK1A38
reg32.doc: Accepts anything. Same as turing UNK0348. Value seems ignored.

reg32.name: UNK1A3C
reg32.doc: Accepts anything. Same as turing UNK034C. Goes to PROP, ROP.

bitfield.name: MODE

value.name: QUERY
value.doc: Writes QUERY_ID at word 0, queried value at word 1.

value.name: COUNTER
value.doc: Writes queried counter at word 0, zero at word 1.

value.name: STRMOUT_NO_OVERFLOW
value.doc: UNIT=STRMOUT. 1 if generated primitives fit in available space, 0 if not.

value.name: STRMOUT_DROPPED_PRIMITIVES
value.doc: UNIT=STRMOUT. Returns COUNTER_GENERATED_PRIMITIVES - COUNTER_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK. Word 0 and word 1 are *reversed* here: the result goes to word 0, SEQUENCE goes to word 1.

value.name: STRMOUT_OFFSET
value.doc: UNIT=STRMOUT. Indexed by STRMOUT buffer id.

bitfield.name: SHORT
bitfield.doc: If set, writes only the first word. Only supported by QUERY/ZERO; QUERY/SAMPLE, QUERY/STRMOUT_PRED, QUERY/ZCULL*
